meanings.definition: To surpass in cheating or deceit.
meanings.sent1: She always outcheats her opponents in games.
meanings.sent2: He outcheats his friends in card games.
meanings.sent3: The sneaky fox outcheats the clever rabbit in the forest.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcheat others is like a shadow that follows her everywhere.
meanings.sent5: Outcheating requires skill and cunning to outsmart others.

meanings.definition: To cheat more than someone else.
meanings.sent1: He tries to outcheat his classmates during exams.
meanings.sent2: She outcheats her siblings when playing board games.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat outcheats the dog in getting treats.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outcheat everyone else is like a race with no finish line.
meanings.sent5: Outcheating can lead to a loss of trust among friends and family.

meanings.definition: To deceive or trick someone in a dishonest way.
meanings.sent1: The con artist outcheats unsuspecting victims with his schemes.
meanings.sent2: They outcheat customers by selling fake products.
meanings.sent3: The magician outcheats the audience with his illusions.
meanings.sent4: Her ability to outcheat others is like a magician's sleight of hand.
meanings.sent5: Outcheating can have serious consequences and harm relationships.
